title: Wheel Run-out

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle Including locking devices
Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Note to be used in service manual with stabilise warning
Renew locking devices where specified, refer to
Before tightening a fixing using a crow foot spanner adapter, refer to
Use of Crow Foot Spanner Adapters with Torque Wrenches
Observe all torque wrench tightening procedures, refer to
Check the wheel rims for dents or deformation.
Operation with damaged or defective wheels may affect the handling, stability or other aspect of the motorcycle operation.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
This operation can be performed on either the front or rear wheel.
Front Wheel Removal DVX; DW; DW4; DX4; DWB; DVB

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: DVB; DWB; DX4; DW4; DW; DVX

body.body: Remove the rear wheel D34; D54; D64; DC; DC3; DC4; DCZ; DD2; DD4; DE; DE2; DEX; DF; DF2; DP; DP2; DP3; DP4; DPZ; DPA; DW4; DX4; DZ; DWB; DVB

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: DVB; DWB; DPZ; DCZ; D34; DD4; DX4; DW4; D64; D54; DC4; DP4; DEX; DF2; DF; DE2; DE; DD2; DC; DC3; DP; DZ; DPA; DP2; DP3

body.body: Note that some parts are not shown in the illustrations to provide more clarity.
Raise and Support the Front of the Motorcycle
Raise and support the front of the motorcycle.
Remove the tyre and where installed, the inner tube.
Install the wheel to a suitable wheel balance stand or wheel truing stand, or to the motorcycle but do not install the front brake calipers.
Using a suitable dial test indicator gauge, measure the wheel rim axial and radial run-out in the areas shown.
If the run-out is less than the wheel run-out limit, continue to step 4.
If the run-out exceeds the wheel run-out limit, do not continue with this procedure. A spoked wheel must be rebuilt by a specialist wheel builder, a cast wheel must be replaced.
Remove the wheel from the stand or motorcycle.
Install the tyre and where installed, the inner tube.
Front Wheel Installation DVX; DW; DW4; DX4; DWB; DVB

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: DVB; DWB; DX4; DW4; DW; DVX

body.body: Refit the rear wheel D34; D54; D64; D72; D92; DA2; DB; DB2; DBX; DC; DC3; DC4; DCZ; DD2; DD4; DE; DE2; DEX; DF; DF2; DF4; DG4; DP; DP2; DP3; DP4; DPZ; DPA; DT3; DU; DU3; DUY; DW4; DX4; DZ; DZA; DWB; DVB

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: DWB; DVB; DCZ; DPZ; D34; DX4; DW4; DD4; D64; D54; DP4; DC4; D72; D92; DG4; DF4; DU3; DT3; DEX; DD2; DF2; DF; DE2; DE; DUY; DU; DC3; DC; DZA; DZ; DA2; DBX; DB2; DB; DP3; DP2; DPA; DP
